results.byline: By Frances Robles and Andre Paultre
results.title: Vigilante Justice Rises in Haiti and Crime Plummets
results.abstract: Civilians have killed at least 160 gang members in Haiti, a human rights group says. Residents say they feel safer, but others worry that it will lead to even more violence.

media.caption: Men with machetes, part of a self-defense initiative to keep gangs from gaining control of their neighborhood, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti.

results.adx_keywords: Paleontology;Dinosaurs;Feathers;Fossils;Birds;your-feed-science;Evolution (Biology)
results.title: How Did Birds First Take Off?
results.abstract: It took 150 million years for feathered dinosaurs to master flight and become the birds we see overhead today.

media.caption: Various examples of a branch of early birds that evolved 130 million years ago, called enantiornithines: male Feitianius (6); female Feitianius (5); Orienantius (4); center Sulcavis (7); Avimaia (1); Falcatakely (3); and Longipteryx (2).

results.byline: By Sameer Yasir, Mujib Mashal and Hari Kumar
results.title: India’s Worst Rail Disaster in Decades Convulses Country Dependent on Trains
results.abstract: The disaster killed at least 288 people, and a preliminary government report described it as a “three-way accident” involving two passenger trains and an idled cargo train. Officials were investigating possible signal failure.

media.caption: Railway workers used excavators to remove wreckage from the derailment and collision in an effort to bring the tracks back into service.

results.byline: By Chris Cameron and Mark Walker
results.title: Two Black Members of Native Tribes Were Arrested. The Law Sees Only One as Indian.
results.abstract: A Supreme Court ruling barred Oklahoma from prosecuting crimes committed by Native Americans on tribal land, but some Black tribal members are still being prosecuted because they lack “Indian blood.”

media.caption: Michael J. Hill, a Cherokee Nation citizen in Oklahoma, is being prosecuted in state court because he was found to not be legally Indian.
